intro: Erigeron variifolius, commonly known as the variableleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that vary in size and shape along the stem. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
